column1: Moreover, I am of the view that the clarifications given in the said letter, marked ‘X1’, will
be an adequate and efficacious remedy in resolving the impugned issues especially because
the instant application is a public interest litigation instituted by the Petitioner.
In light of the above, it is important for this Court to make a strong observation that the
Commissioner General of Land, Conservator General of Forests, all District Secretaries
and all Divisional Secretaries should be bound by the contents in paragraph 3 of the draft
letter ‘X1’. Further, this Court makes an observation that the Secretary to the Ministry of
Wildlife  &  Forest  Resources  Conservation  is  ought  to  take  immediate  steps  to  issue  a
formal communication particularly with the contents embodied in paragraph 3 of the said
draft letter, marked X1, and to communicate such directions to the Forest Conservator
Secretaries/ all Divisional Secretaires. The above observations are being made in the best
interest of justice and also for the benefit of present and future generations whose duty
should be to safeguard the invaluable forests in the country.
On a careful consideration of the whole matter, I have come to the conclusion based on
the  special  circumstances  of  this  case  that I should  exercise  my  discretion  to  refuse  the
application of the Petitioner subject to the above observations made by this Court.
